[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_latest_ledger_info_in_epoch()] [Epoch impersonation] Can an attacker query future epochs at line 118 and exploit race conditions to prematurely access next epoch's validator configuration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_previous_epoch_ending()] [Epoch skip attack] Can manipulating epoch boundaries allow an attacker to skip epochs, breaking the invariant that epochs must be consecutive? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_committed_version()] [Committed version lie] If get_committed_version() returns a stale cached version while the database has advanced, can this cause validators to accept conflicting blocks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: set_latest_ledger_info()] [Signature validation bypass] Does set_latest_ledger_info() validate the signatures in LedgerInfoWithSignatures, or can an attacker cache invalid ledger info that bypasses quorum requirements? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_latest_ledger_info()] [Consensus split] Can different validators cache different 'latest' ledger infos due to race conditions, causing them to diverge on the chain tip? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: put_ledger_info()] [Ledger info replacement] Can an attacker overwrite existing ledger info for an epoch with different signatures or state roots, enabling history rewriting attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_epoch_state()] [Equivocation detection bypass] Can corrupted epoch states disable equivocation detection by providing incorrect validator sets to consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: put_ledger_info()] [State root validation] Does put_ledger_info() validate that the state root in the ledger info matches the actual committed state, or can mismatched roots be persisted? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_latest_ledger_info()] [Merkle root consistency] Can cached ledger info contain a different state root than the database, breaking state proof verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info()] [State commitment fork] Can epoch-ending ledger infos with different state roots for the same epoch cause state forks that require hard forks to resolve? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: put_block_info()] [Block proposer verification] Does put_block_info() validate that the block proposer in NewBlockEvent is an authorized validator, or can arbitrary proposers be recorded? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: put_block_info()] [Block height uniqueness] Can multiple blocks have the same height due to malformed NewBlockEvents, breaking block height uniqueness invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: put_block_info()] [Block timestamp manipulation] Can NewBlockEvent contain manipulated timestamps that violate consensus timing requirements, and are these validated before storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: get_block_info()] [Block info forgery] Can an attacker inject fake BlockInfo entries that weren't generated from legitimate NewBlockEvents? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Functions: get_committed_version() + get_latest_ledger_info()] [TOCTOU race] Can the committed version change between get_committed_version() and get_latest_ledger_info() calls, causing inconsistent query results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Functions: get_epoch() + get_epoch_state()] [Epoch change race] Can an epoch change occur between get_epoch() and get_epoch_state() calls, causing validators to use wrong epoch configurations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Functions: get_block_height_by_version() + get_block_info()] [Block lookup race] Can blocks be pruned between these calls, causing get_block_info() to return None for a height that was just successfully looked up? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Functions: get_usage() + put_usage()] [Usage accounting race] Can concurrent usage updates cause the total usage to be incorrectly calculated due to lost updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/ledger_db/ledger_metadata_db.rs] [Function: write_pruner_progress()] [Pruning beyond committed] Can write_pruner_progress() be called with a version greater than the committed version, causing active data to be marked for pruning? (Critical)
